title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1 §§ 272-1.10 - Labeling or advertising when certain United States Department of Agriculture grading terms used
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1 §§ 272-1.10 - Labeling or advertising when certain United States Department of Agriculture grading terms used

State Regulations

If meat is advertised, sold or offered for sale at retail
and the carcass or part thereof from which such meat is derived has been marked
with a United States Department of Agriculture grade other than "prime" or
"choice," the grading term or recognized abbreviation thereof of such meat
shall appear contiguous to the true name of such meat and be at least as equal
in size to and as prominent as the true name, for example: BEEF ROUND U.S. COMM'L. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1
§§
272-1.10

Repealed

New

York State Register June 22, 2016/Volume XXXVIII, Issue 25, eff. 6/22/2016

Adopted

New

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
